alert.note: Alert for Boise Mountains; Camas Prairie; Southern Twin Falls County; Southwest Highlands; Upper Treasure Valley; Western Magic Valley (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Boise (Southwestern Idaho and Eastern Oregon)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 08 at 8:13PM MDT by NWS Boise
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Twin Falls, western Jerome, southeastern Elmore, east central Owyhee, southwestern Camas and Gooding Counties through 900 PM MDT... At 813 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Prairie to near Salmon Falls Reservoir. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Rogerson, Filer, Buhl and Wendell around 820 PM MDT. Twin Falls, Jerome, Winter Spring and Magic Valley Regional Airport around 830 PM MDT. Kimberly and Timber Butte around 840 PM MDT. Hansen and Rock Creek around 850 PM MDT. Fairfield, Gooding, Corral and Hagerman around 900 PM MDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Boise Mountains; Camas Prairie; Southern Twin Falls County; Southwest Highlands; Upper Treasure Valley; Western Magic Valley
